text: Philadelphia or Philadelpheia (), was a town of ancient Cilicia, and later of Isauria. It was located in the interior of Cilicia Aspera, on the river Calycadnus, above Aphrodisias. It became an episcopal see; no longer the site of a residential bishop, it remains under the name Philadelphia Minor, a titular see of the Roman Catholic Church.Catholic Hierarchy Its site is tentatively located near İmşi Ören in Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Cilicia Category:Populated places in ancient Isauria Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:History of Mersin Province Category:Catholic titular sees in Asia
title: Philadelphia (Cilicia)
